snippet: Mr. Bae and Mr. Miller arrived Saturday night at a base near Tacoma, Wash., after a secret negotiation by the director of national intelligence, James R. Clapper Jr.
abstract: North Korea releases Kenneth Bae and Matthew Todd Miller, Americans who had been accused of trying to subvert the state, after James R Clapper Jr, director of national intelligence for the United States, flew to country on secret mission; securing release was unusual role for Clapper, nation's most senior intelligence official.

byline.contributor: Choe Sang-Hun contributed reporting from Seoul, South Korea, Ashley Southall from New York, and Stacey Solie from Joint Base Lewis-McChord.

lead_paragraph: Mr. Bae and Mr. Miller arrived Saturday night at a base near Tacoma, Wash., after a secret negotiation by the director of national intelligence, James R. Clapper Jr.

headline.main: Kenneth Bae and Matthew Todd Miller, Released by North Korea, Are Back on U.S. Soil
headline.print_headline: N. Korea Frees 2 After Mission by U.S. Spy Chief
